question.title: Dialog boxes not auto-closing even with autoDismissAlerts and autoGrantPermissions
question.body:
Iâ€™m using Appium to automate the testing of an Android app. The automation works fine for most scenarios, but the issue arises when certain system dialog boxes (such as permissions or Google Sign-In popups) appear. Even though I have set the relevant capabilities like autoDismissAlerts and autoAcceptAlerts, these dialogs do not close automatically during the test execution.

I expect Appium to automatically handle and dismiss these dialogs when they appear, allowing the test to continue without manual intervention.

I am using below code:

 driver.navigate().back();
 driver.switchTo().alert().dismiss();
 driver.switchTo().alert().accept();

Alert alert = driver.switchTo().alert();
alert.accept();
alert.dismiss();

question_comments.body: You should edit your question to mention that you have this as a (not ideal) workaround instead of putting it in the comments.

I'm currently using Thread.sleep(2000); followed by driver.findElementById("com.google.android.gms:id/cancel").c‌​lick(); to close the dialog, but I need the dialog to close automatically without manual interaction and Thread.sleep(2000).
